docs.snippet: An issue of refunding and improvement mortgage 6 per cent gold bonds of the Staten Island Edison Corporation, due on June 14, 1933, is to be offered in the amount of $7,424,000 in exchange for a like amount of 3 per cent gold notes of the corporation...
docs.lead_paragraph: An issue of refunding and improvement mortgage 6 per cent gold bonds of the Staten Island Edison Corporation, due on June 14, 1933, is to be offered in the amount of $7,424,000 in exchange for a like amount of 3 per cent gold notes of the corporation due on June 15 next, par for par, plue $10 in cash for each $1,000 note exchanged.
docs.abstract: To offer issue of refunding bonds

headline.main: REFUNDING BY UNIT OF ASSOCIATED GAS; Staten Island Edison to Offer $7,424,000 of 6% Bonds in Exchange for 3% Notes. OLD ISSUE DUE ON JUNE 15 Chase Harris Forbes Corporation Ends Official Connection With Parent Concern.

docs.snippet: Judging by the further spirited advance in security prices yesterday and the second-day comment in financial circles, overnight reflection upon the bankers' concerted investment enterprise served to heighten Wall Street's enthusiasm for the project.
docs.lead_paragraph: Judging by the further spirited advance in security prices yesterday and the second-day comment in financial circles, overnight reflection upon the bankers' concerted investment enterprise served to heighten Wall Street's enthusiasm for the project.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 31. -- Business activity showed little change or a slight decline in most countries covered by the current weekly survey of conditions abroad by the Commerce Department.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 31. -- Business activity showed little change or a slight decline in most countries covered by the current weekly survey of conditions abroad by the Commerce Department.

headline.main: FEW IMPROVEMENTS IN FOREIGN MARKETS; Great Britain Is Less Optimistic -- Italy Also Reports No Change of Importance. CZECHOSLOVAKIA HAS GAINS Unemployment Falls 12 Per Cent, According to Survey by Our Commerce Department.

docs.snippet: WHEN the forces of protest against things as they are -- the forces which gave rise to the Soviet Republic, the Third International and many a lesser movement -- surveyed the world which they would conquer, South America offered both an invitation...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN the forces of protest against things as they are -- the forces which gave rise to the Soviet Republic, the Third International and many a lesser movement -- surveyed the world which they would conquer, South America offered both an invitation and a problem.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICAN RADICALISM SCORES A VICTORY IN CHILE; Allied With the Army in a Paradoxical Revolt, the Movement Wins Control of the Government in a Disturbed Country

docs.snippet: Tax Spurs Advance Orders. Many orders for merchandise coming under the new excise levies featured the business placed in this market yesterday. Delivery was sought prior to the effect date of the taxes at midnight June 20. Orders for toilet goods...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tax Spurs Advance Orders. Many orders for merchandise coming under the new excise levies featured the business placed in this market yesterday. Delivery was sought prior to the effect date of the taxes at midnight June 20. Orders for toilet goods were reported particularly numerous, covering in some cases from one to three months' normal needs.

docs.snippet: Formation of Latin-American Associates, Inc., for the purpose of "supervising investment holdings of bonds representing approximately 144 different loans of fifteen nations, nine States, six provinces, six departments and fifteen cities in Latin...
docs.lead_paragraph: Formation of Latin-American Associates, Inc., for the purpose of "supervising investment holdings of bonds representing approximately 144 different loans of fifteen nations, nine States, six provinces, six departments and fifteen cities in Latin America, on which, defaults amounting to 45 per cent have already occurred," was announced yesterday.
docs.abstract: Protective coms formed; depositories for bonds and stocks named

headline.main: TO ACT ON 144 LOANS IN LATIN AMERICA; New Organization to Supervise Investments Now in Default of Interest.

docs.snippet: Credits and collections in LatinAmerican countries continued to improve through the second quarter of the year, according to the current analysis of conditions in twenty-one South American nations completed yesterday by the foreign credit interchange...
docs.lead_paragraph: Credits and collections in LatinAmerican countries continued to improve through the second quarter of the year, according to the current analysis of conditions in twenty-one South American nations completed yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men.

headline.main: CREDITS IMPROVED IN SOUTH AMERICA; Survey Reveals Upward Trend Observed Early This Year Is Continuing. COLLECTIONS ALSO BETTER Caution Used by Exporters Before Shipping Resulted in Payment Gain, W.S. Swingle Says.
